revised_title: Discovering Early Galaxies through the Lyman-alpha Forest
tldr: The author presents evidence for a new population of baryons with redshift values between 1.8 and 2.8, which have a mass density greater than all previously known baryonic matter at these redshifts. These baryons share similar properties with gaseous galactic discs, suggesting that they are early-stage galaxies. The discovery challenges the standard picture of galactic evolution and provides insights into the formation and development of galaxies.
